reviews.review: I mean it's fine, besides the bugs. The ragdoll physics are pretty funny. Would only get it for Garry's Mod mounting and not for actual story telling. Either go play the original or buy Black Mesa.

An Epic Game, The Scientists Running Around Are Funny, The Bosses Are Easy But I Can't blame them, 10/10 would recommend playing
although this is just a worse version of half life, it has ragdolls and a good flashlight

half-life if it had gastrointestinal diseases lemme explain: this game is LITTERED with bugs and glitches and im just gonna name the most notable ones here

barnacle tongues dont touch the ground
skipping the entirety of we go hostiles by shooting a scientist
sentries dont react to gunshot sounds only gettin hit by them
some cut scenes dont play out correctly causing bits of the story to fly over peoples head that dont know the story
electrical damage no longer kills the player it only hurts them causing many puzzles to be broken 
ragdolls break some cutscenes
the tentacles in blast pit have a much smaller hitbox then normal 
weird visual effects bugs in residue processings convener maze make it look like you just took 8 tabs of lsd 
gun physics are broken causing projectiles to go to slow or too fast
bullet weapons deal a lot less damage
sound effects and dialog are missing from some parts of the game
the gonarch doesnt attack it just stands there and dies 
crowbar only makes concrete sounds 
and a whole host of issues that i cant even list

listen this is a very fun tech demo and all and seeing realistic water and true ragdoll physics in the original half life is fun for like two minutes but the fact this is sold at the same price as the original half life is weird and is a scam if you havent played through it already just go play through original gold source half life and if you want it for gmod just buy every valve game for 2 dollars during the steam summer sale

[h1] Buy it only for Gmod Content [/h1]
hey before you start your aggro on me.
i love Half-life! but not hl:source since its janky as hell. play the original one instead.
all you get from this, is just shiny water and ragdoll physics.

but!!!!!
if you buy it for Gmod, you get all the weapons and maps and npcs and everything in your spawnmenu!!
means that you can literally crush npc scientists with your superweapons instead of citizens!
that makes it worth. right?
love it cant wait for half life source 2
this game sucks it is laggy&just a terrible excuse for a game i give it 0 stars out of 10
Despite it's flaws and the fact it's barely any sort of a remaster, it's still better than Grand Theft Auto Trilogy Definitive Edition.

Well I finally decided to give up on my GOTY version which I cannot even find the disc for.
Knowing that it no longer worked on any modern computers I lost it.
So I tried GOG they Dinne have it, so here I came and chose source over patched original or black mesa.
After playing for about two hours I am pretty pleased, sure there are bugs and glitches as there were in the original.
I find the enhanced physics a fun bump on jumping puzzles, and AI to be fun but not really more challenging.
The graphical improvements are not earth shattering but make it look less aged and 1080P support.
Yes I paid my own money for this and would much rather have a physical copy but here I am.
honestly i bought it for gmod bu i do enjoy the game series as a whole, i heard there were a bunch of bugs from engine updates but i havn't seen any so far!
jogo muito bom para o ano que foi criado, um marco na historia dos games de primeira pessoa
es viejo y tiene fallas y mecanicas que actualmente son terisoasa ,pero sorprendentemente ,es bueno.

Fix missing music/sound effects in Source Engine games (Valve games, etc.) on Fedora

Unfortunately, on Fedora, some Valve games have a bit of an issue regarding completely skipping playing certain audio files.
None of this causes any crashing, but can lead to a worse gaming experience, confusion, and the appearance of buggyness- and generally isn‚Äôt great.
To work around this, please refer to the following steps, and all the games‚Äô audio will then work perfectly.

You need to open your Terminal emulator, either from the usual application menu place, or by using the keyboard shortcut Ctrl+Alt+T, or sometimes it‚Äôs Super+T AND THEN type the following into it, entering your password when it prompts you.

sudo su
sudo setsebool -P selinuxuser_execheap 1

That‚Äôs it. Your game will now function as intended, enjoy being able to hear the soundtracks, music, sound effects, etc! Especially ‚ÄòStill Alive‚Äô, and the banger that Half-Life 2‚Äôs soundtrack is, amongst others.

Effectivaly Just a Port of Half-Life 1 to the Source Engine, not a "Re-Master" or "Re-Make". Also filled with glitches. Just go play Half-Life 1 (also on steam) or play Black Mesa: Source if you want to play a real "Re-Mastser". Effectivly useless and obslete unless you want to mount Half-Life 1 onto G-Mod or somthing.

Buy Half-Life 1: Garry's Mod asset pack
Includes 2 items: Half-Life Deathmatch: Source, Half-Life: Source

This game is fun, even if it has a lot of glitches. The rag doll physics are nice, too. Some things could be fixed, like some AI and other things. Still fun to play. Too much hate is given to this game, honestly.

absolutely horrible, please don't experience half life like this. instead play either the original half life PC release on steam or if you want a more modern experience just play the fan remake Black Mesa. absolutely horrific.

Half-Life: Source is a POS game. It has an infestation of Bugs and as a result, unenjoyable in my experience at least. Residue Processing for example has many graphics issues makes the game unplayable. In Blast Pit a Security Guard who is supposed to be killed by one of the tentacles doesn't die and as a result the two NPCs will be locked in a never ending battle. The Gonarch doesn't attack you nor spawn baby head crabs. In one map the skybox smears, Sound effects like footsteps, buttons and doors and the crowbar hitting things are messed up. The Music files will stop playing during level transitions. Certain enemies don't spawn, corpses are static, lack the rag-doll physics. The flash light glitches during the conveyor belt maze in Residue Processing. Barnacle tongues aren't rendered properly, The Nihilanth's portal ball attack are indestructible. Some AH-64 Apache helicopters have more HP than others. In other instances like in We've Got Hostiles the first HECU soldier that you encounter will shoot at you instead of the scientist, which drastically kills the moment, and if you hurt the scientist who screams "FOR GOD'S SAKE OPEN THE SILO DOORS! IT'S OUR ONLY HOPE!" he will stop, skip the scripted event and open the door to the Security Guard, thus enabling you to skip that entire map. The scientist will float above his chair in Anomalous Materials. This game is just terrible. So many bugs... If I were you I'd play Crowbar Collective's Black Mesa instead. It totally rocks!
one of the only games my macbook pro runs great. a great game that influenced almost every FPS going forward.

when i was younger i played two games.  Half life and dues ex.  These two games set the benchmark for all future games and although some great games have been released since these in my opinion are still the best.  If you don't own them then buy them !!!!

As far as 'old' games go, this is a classic. True, the graphics are poor and there are a few bugs, but the game is fast paced, fun and tells a story. If you are fond of Castle Wolfenstein ad the original Doom, you'll like this game.
um dos melhor jogos ja feitos na historia da humanidade

This is an ok way to play an amazing game. Half-Life is iconic and it sucks that Valve hasn't done anything themselves to provide a great way to play. This source port of the original makes it easier to run from a compatibility setting but still runs based on restrictions from the 90's. I must recommend to anyone who wishes to play Half-Life that they go buy Black Mesa.

Black Mesa is the remake that this likely should've been. It improves the quality and feel of the game. It also makes it closer to the gameplay that can be seen Half-Life 2. It does make some changes to levels and mechanics but largely for the betterment of the game while keeping story and iconic moments intact. 

By all means, buy this if you wish or play the original Half-Life but I can't say it is quite as enjoyable of an experience in 2022 as Black Mesa would be.

Black Mesa: https://store.steampowered.com/app/362890/Black_Mesa/

It's buggy, and you should play half life first, but it's pretty fun for a second playthrough.
